sense.name: a shout! by an individual, as a command, warning, insult
sense.examples: A yell to be careful from a pedestrian caught John's attention. The speaker was drowned out by yells from the protesters.

sense.name: a sudden emotional vocalization
sense.examples: Mary gave a yell of pain when her hand touched the hot skillet. The woman's yells of childbirth could be heard down the hall.

sense.name: an organized group cheer
sense.examples: The soldiers gave the rebel yell as they stormed the hill in battle. The cheerleaders lead the crowd in the yells for the home team.
